intro: Tuberosa, commonly known as the tuberose, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its large, fragrant white flowers that bloom at night. The plant produces edible underground tubers, which are used in traditional medicine and as a food source in some cultures. Tuberosa is also cultivated for its ornamental value and its strong, sweet scent. Its growth habits include a dormant period during the winter, followed by rapid growth and flowering in the warmer months.
